definition: to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast
to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast

sentences.english: The sun warmed up the seat nicely.
sentences.chinese: 太陽把座椅曬得暖烘烘的。

sentences.english: Sudden growth in the holding cup of coffee, which is when you miss the feelings of fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 捧着杯暖烘烘的咖啡，裏面卻是思念發酵時的心情。

sentences.english: The dog nestled up against the warm radiator .
sentences.chinese: 狗倚着暖烘烘的散熱器。

sentences.english: He wanted a nice drink by the side of a warm fire at home.
sentences.chinese: 他想在家坐在暖烘烘的爐火旁，喝上一杯美酒。

sentences.english: He was glowing and warm with delight.
sentences.chinese: 他樂得容光煥發，心裏暖烘烘的。

sentences.english: CLAY:Yeah, it always warms my heart to see a well-fed bird.
sentences.chinese: 看到一隻鳥喂得這麼好，總是讓我心裏暖烘烘的。

sentences.english: Their room was good and warm.
It's as warm as toast in here with the oven on.
sentences.chinese: 還是到廚房裏來吧，這裏爐子開着，暖烘烘的。

definition: variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
Nuannuan district of Keelung City 基隆市[Ji1 long2 shi4], Taiwan
variant of 熱乎|热乎[re4 hu5]
